name: NeuVectorScan
description: Scan an image using the NeuVector Vulnerability Scanner
author: NeuVector Inc.

options.local: local NeuVector controller in build pipeline

inputs.name: neuvectorController
inputs.label: NeuVector controller
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the service endpoint of the NeuVector Controller which will perform the scan. To create an endpoint, click the Manage link and create a new NeuVector controller service endpoint.

inputs.name: controllerLicense
inputs.label: Controller license
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the license file to apply to the local NeuVector controller. Example: `$(Agent.TempDirectory)/neuvector-license.txt`.

inputs.name: controllerPort
inputs.label: Controller port
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the port of the NeuVector controller service container.

inputs.name: containerRegistry
inputs.label: Container registry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry service connection which contains the image to scan. If no container registry is provided, the controller scans only local images.

inputs.name: tag
inputs.label: Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: Tag of the image to scan.

inputs.name: failOnHighSeverityThreshold
inputs.label: Fail on high severity vulnerability threshold

inputs.name: highSeverityThreshold
inputs.label: High severity threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Threshold of high severity vulnerabilities which will cause a failed build.

inputs.name: failOnMediumSeverityThreshold
inputs.label: Fail on medium severity vulnerability threshold

inputs.name: mediumSeverityThreshold
inputs.label: Medium severity threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Threshold of high severity vulnerabilities which will cause a failed build.

inputs.name: cveBlacklist
inputs.label: CVE black list
inputs.helpMarkDown: List of CVEs which will cause a failed build. Provide a CVE per line (e.g. CVE-2019-10098)

inputs.name: reportJsonOutputPath
inputs.label: JSON output path
inputs.helpMarkDown: If provided, the scan report will be saved to the provided path as JSON. Example: `$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/neuvector-scan-report.json`.

inputs.name: reportMarkdownOutputPath
inputs.label: Markdown output path
inputs.helpMarkDown: If provided, the scan report will be saved to the provided path as Markdown. Example: `$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/neuvector-scan-report.md`.
